Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: foodie808
Reviews.Content: The Charterhouse is a really great place to stay while in HK. It is conveniently located near most everything,ie; Times Square, Wanchai ferry etc. friendly staff, walk to almost everything. Breakfast buffet could use some help but thats ok. Rooms kind of small but cozy and clean. Good A/C, nice strong shower. Ask for David the concierge he is especially helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Bit worn but superb location”
Reviews.Author: dthk_msia
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights last week. The hotel location is between Wan Chai MTR and Causeway Bay MTR so you could presumably go to either station and walk to the hotel if you're not carrying much luggage or get a cab. I had a room on the business floor which placed me above the traffic noise. My room was south facing which gave me a good view of Morrison Hill and some blocked glimpses of Happy Valley race course. Check-in and check-out was smooth and staff were helpful with any queries that you might have. The room was a bit worn but well kept as housekeeping was on the ball so I had no problems there. The wifi connection in the room was good and was also included in the price of the room for rooms on the business floor so this was a plus point for me. Breakfast was also decent but you could reasonably do without it as there is a great selection of eating places in the neighbourhood which will enable you to try the local cusine as well. The central location is the great thing about staying here as the entire Causeway Bay shopping district is within walking distance as well as the Wanchai nightlife. Plus, with close proximity to Star Ferry and the MTR, you can presumably get anywhere within half an hour.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey hotel”
Reviews.Author: missazza
Reviews.Content: I booked a room on the business floor which is about SG$900 (yeah, its pricey) for 5nights. Its about 5-10mins walk from Causeway Bay MTR, very convenient but we took a cab from Hong Kong station to avoid the hassle of dragging our luggage from the MTR. There's a few convenient stores around the corner like 7-11, Circle k. Hotel is old, interior is old, heck everything is old. Check-in was a breeze, it took about 10mins. Our room number was 2012 which has the most magnificent view, especially at night. The room is clean, bed is very comfortable but the pillows are too soft & flat, had a neckache everytime i sleep on it. The room was equipped with a electric kettle, compliemtary coffee/tea, mini bar, free wifi, flat screen TV, a table & chair which is a plus to apply my makeup. The room is really small, there is no hairdryer, complimentry bottled drink (mineral water), have to login again & again to use the wifi (other hotels is auto-login/recognised), TV program have limited english channel. Hotel & room decor is very old & outdated, its about time for a renovation. One of our relatives stayed in the same hotel, they stayed on the 10th floor (not business floor) which had the exact same amenities. Hence, we only paid extra for having a magnificent view. The hotel staff are friendly but sometimes i felt that they kinda hesitant if they should approach me (Us) or not, maybe because i don't look rich enough? (LOL) . Overall, its a good hotel but its too pricey. The only reason i booked this hotel as its just a few mins walk to The Muslim Canteen. Basically, its due to convenient sake to have a guaranteed halal breakfast every day. There's also a middle eastern restaurant across the st & halal pizza joint down the st as well. Would i stay in this hotel again? Nope. No doubt, its very convenient but i can get the exact same thing or better in another hotel & save a few hundred bucks at the same time.

Reviews.Title: “Location vs Service”
Reviews.Author: Baul_37
Reviews.Content: A 6-day stay has mixed experience. Positives-- Ideal location, clean property. In room amenities are fine and fair enough. Many staffs are cordial and smile. Fast check out Negatives- Front desk staffs are rude ( we experienced during check in). Poor TV channels. No variation in breakfast. Poor menu (we found same menu for 6 days). In a nutsheel, poor hotel. I will not suggest.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: JB39
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at The Charterhouse on three occasions and have to say that our expectations are always exceeded. The staff go out of their way to help and willingly assist even with the most complicated requests. I would recommend staying on the S floor as the extra benefits are really worthwhile. The location of the hotel is great, very easy for getting around town. I will definitely stay here again on my next visit to Hong Kong

Reviews.Title: “Only positive is the location!”
Reviews.Author: Adithi_85
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 4 days during a business trip to HK. We have previously stayed at the Novotel Hotel, so given that this was not a patch in comparison. The only positive is the location - very well located and lots of stuff near by. My biggest concern was that I was on a non smokinf floor and still every room had strong smoke smell. There were filled ashtrays and butts all over my room. Cleanliness wise I was totally disappointed. Food at the hotel was also just average. This is a ok hotel for maybe a day or two but beyond that its tough to stay here - and dotn expect any luxury!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and the S floor has everything you could need...”
Reviews.Author: sophinBangkok
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at the hotel, and I wouldn't hesitate to stay again. The location in Causeway Bay is fabulous - minutes from Times Square for shopping, lots of different restaurants nearby, local convenience stores and easy access to the MTR. The staff we encountered, Oliver, Carol and the Head Concierge, Provis, were all incredibly accommodating and our room attendant was both polite and respectful. We had some particularly challenging requests in obtaining visas for mainland China. Provis made every effort possible to make this happen, not only on a Sunday, but on a public holiday weekend too. I take my proverbial hat off to him. The S floor rooms are all newly renovated and have comfortable queen sized beds, a flat screen TV, fast efficient wi-fi and bijous little bathrooms. Space has always been at a premium in Hong Kong, and to have everything you need is a great thing indeed. We are from England origianlly but live in Bangkok, and have a lot of trouble getting a good nights sleep with humidity and heat. Not so here, we both slept like babies... ! The bathroom has a super big wet room shower with rain shower, regular shower and body jets, a good way to wake up. The workspace is ergonomically well designed and the desk chair is suitable for sitting for a period of time. Hanging space is sufficient and there's even a luggage rack and drawer for extra items and shoes. Breakfast was included in our rate and we thoroughly enjoyed a basic breakfast with freshly cooked eggs, crisp tasty bacon and fresh bread. All in all, I think this is a great place to stay, good value and the perfect spot from which to voyage out into Hong Kong, whether you are on business or travelling for pleasure. Thank you to the GM, Mr Rodrigues, Mr Yau and the team. We will be back...!

Reviews.Title: “excellant value”
Reviews.Author: themayorinexile
Reviews.Content: I always stay at the Charterhouse if I can--indeed a few years ago I lived there a month. I find the staff to be excellant and very helpful. The location is superb--near the wet market, between Causeway Bay MTR and Wan Chai MTR. Many good restaurants in the area. Also, Champ's,the sports bar in the basement, is well managed, has a nice happy hour, and is usual a convial place.

Reviews.Title: “Good location ,”
Reviews.Author: Ionut C
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is the main advantage . The furniture is preatty old , but if you are travelling for business for 2 nights , this hotel can be useful . Wireless internet is available only in the lobby , In the rooms you have only cable access. I did not noticed anylanguage barrier with the concierge bacause I tend to look myself for any travelling info . Breakfast was really poor . I mean , there wasn t enough food for all the people which were in the breakfast room with me . So better next day I choose to go out and have breakfast . Small room like anywhere else in HK .

Reviews.Title: “Good location for convention centre and causeway bay”
Reviews.Author: Kengkla
Reviews.Content: Stay for 1 night for business Normally, I prefer to stay in Tsim Sha Tsui area, but this time I choose HK side for convenient access to HK convention center which is about 10 mins walk. It is also just 5 mins walk thru local market to Timesquare and causeway bay MTR. The Charterhouse is just like HK standard - small room. Bed and bath are clean and comfortable, no complain. Price is comparable with other same standard hotel in HK.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: William B
Reviews.Content: I travelled on business and was greeted as a friend who has returned to see an old pal despite being my first time there. all of the staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was spacious and clean, the bed very comfortable. Washing facilities clean and well stocked. Restaurant for both breakfast and dinner offered excellent choices. Great location for going sightseeing everything is near enough to see on foot almost! Shopping, markets, Stanly etc all literally on your doorstep. All in all a very clean, welcoming and relaxing hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Service leaves a lot to be desired”
Reviews.Author: mayukhdewan
Reviews.Content: The language barrier was big problem with the concierge desk as well as the reception.the receptionist ms step...ie was extremely rude on check in. The housekeeping didnt clean the room regularly, they even just wiped my curry stained spoon and put it back on the coffee stand.i couldnt believe it when i saw the curry stains still visible on the spoon in t he evening.the duvet was just spread ober the bed,with the bedsheet below still crumpled and untucked from the last night. I had booked the airport bus drop 1 day before checkout but when i checked out i was told that i did not have any booking in the concierge desk and they asked me to take the taxi to hong kong central station and then the airport express train. I asked them to tell the taxi driver to drop me at central station but the bell boy told him to drop me directly at the airport.imagine my state when i realised this and was charges 320 dollars to airport instead of 40 dollars to the train station!

Reviews.Title: “charterhouse causeway bay”
Reviews.Author: Bill C
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a Great location in causeway bay. Outside the hotel a block away was the local market, wow were things fresh there! IT really fit my idea of a street market in China and yet there it was right in downdown. Shopping, the wharf, movies were just a short walk away.. The view from my room was nonexistent but it was a great room, fancy shower and all the lights controlled right from my bedside. The dining room was terrific for their buffet breakfast, so many choices and top notch.. We never ate dinner there but that was when the dining room was the most crowded. Bus service right outside hotel made it easy to get to victoria peak and other spots. We took a boat out to Macau and to Lamma island

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but the hotel is a bit dated”
Reviews.Author: aroha436
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the Wan Chai area, so it's excellent for shopping, restaurants and nightlife. I would stay again, but there are more modern hotels in this price bracket. Rooms were a little dated and not quite as clean as they could have been. No free Internet and very limited TV channels. Staff were generally friendly and helpful. Reasonable breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Run Down, but Inexpensive”
Reviews.Author: msav2000
Reviews.Content: Spent one night there, so can not comment on service and most other things. There are only three things that are important and need to be summarized to understand what this is: 1. It is in a good (not the best) location 2. It is very run down 3. It is cheap It has a smell. The furniture is beat up. The beds are worn. The rooms are tiny. The view from my side of the building sucked. The bathroom is in a desperate need of restoration. This is the only hotel in HK/China/Taiwan I ever stayed in in any price category that had no toothpaste and a brush in the bathroom. The breakfast ($19) was so mediocre, I already forgot it. Under any other circumstances I would not ever stay here again. But! The Star Ferry pier is 10 minutes walk away. Same with the Convention Center. Same with MTR. 5 minutes to a tram or a bus. Free internet (wired). And all of this for a very, very reasonable price (under USD100 in my case) when everything else around runs at least for twice as much. So if you are on a budget and need a decent location close to the infrastructure, or could care less where are you are asleep after a long day of tourism, this is a good value choice. BTW, the hotel does not provide the adapters from HK to the US or Euro chargers. There is a packed adapter in the room, but if you open the package a HK $90 (US $12) charge will appear on your bill. It is much wiser to dive into one of the small electronics stores and get one for HK $20 or less.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: PHCSantaBarbara
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a week in April. Upon check in at the HK airport we realized that we had left a package in the taxi we took to the airport. We contacted the Front Desk Manager, Mr. Albert Au. He was amazing. The taxi driver had returned the package to the hotel. Mr. Au contacted us immediately and made all of the arrangements to ship it to us. He was always on top of the situation and was so professional and conscientious to work with. A wonderful person. Now the hotel review. The hotel is located in an excellent section of Hong Kong Island. It is away from the mobs of tourists on Kowloon but a very quick, pleasant, and cheap Star Ferry ride to get to Kowloon. It's a great area to walk around and see local people and places; make sure to enjoy the buffet dinner at the hotel first floor restaurant and the really outstanding restaurant just across the driveway from the hotel (Bazaar). The Star Ferry, convention center, metro, buses, trams, and market are all within a block or so. The hotel rooms are super quiet which is hard in a noisy bustling city. The rooms are very clean, well maintained, and a decent size for Hong Kong. There is wifi in the room. The concierge service is very good and helpful. I would definitely return on my next trip there. This is a great business and tourist hotel. The price is and excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service (Outstanding)”
Reviews.Author: hnw c
Reviews.Content: The Charterhouse provides OUTSTANDING client and guest services. For example, the front desk delivers the iron and ironing board promptly, delivers the electrical adaptors for computers and even provides computer related services within its business center. I am an owner of several US major flag hotels and I can attest that The Charterhouse Staff has no peers... they are simply OUTSTANDING. Simply put, they provide just what you need, on the spot, without question or hassle. Set aside the Waldorf Astoria or the Ritz Carlton's of the world... stay at The Charterhouse without reserve or hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “VERY GOOD”
Reviews.Author: latino692
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is very nice and sometimes has excellent rates (for HK extremely high hotel rates), very nice rooms, very nice restaurant and i appreciatte very much the Manager Mr. Kenny attentions toward a little problem i had with date changes, in wich him and his staff where so helpful. It is well located (near Wanchai and Central Metro), 10 minutes walk to metro; if you wanna stay in a real Hotel this is a good option.

Reviews.Title: “Very average place and small TV”
Reviews.Author: NickBkk
Reviews.Content: I stayed there a couple of nights and even I got the Business Floor, the room has a TV that was the worst I ever seen in many years. Actually the TV was the "highlight" of the room as it was smaller than my own laptop screen and you couldn't even switch off by the remote control, so if you are in bed you need to off it from the TV itself. I really do not understand how come such Hotel in HK can accept to sell their rooms with such TV set ???? About the rest, I got an smoking room and the first night I couldn't sleep well due to the strong smell, but luckyly the second night got better. Bed was at least comfortable. Breakfast was just fine, nothing special but with enough selection to get you going until lunch time. Location is not that bad since you can get to Times Square shopping mall in just 5 minutes walking and there you have a very good selection of restaurants in their top floors. Besides that you have there a subway station (Causeway Bay). Overall is just an average place to stay, but there are much better places at the same level of rates in Wanchai and Cayseway Bay area.

Reviews.Title: “Do not expect a 5 star hotel room”
Reviews.Author: Charles W
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here several times , first time took a regular room wich was realy small and furniture old. Since that visit i have always booked a junior suite , large double room with large bathroom , ore a room on the design floor . These rooms are modern and have all any business man could wish for , flat screen tv , free wifi and a great shower. Restaurants in this hotel are nothing special but many restaurants in the area or a 5 minutes taxi ride away from hotel . Lobby from hotel have had it's best time and first apearence from hotel when entering is realy bad but therefore rooms on design floor are realy nice . Staff of this hotel is very friendly and always very helpfull furthermore this hotel is cheap if compared with other hotels in tne area and this even during dates that large conventions are prganised in hk . Hk convention and exh ctre ab 10 min by feet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service team and good location”
Reviews.Author: Leong F
Reviews.Content: We took 2 rooms at CharterHouse for 4 nights in Feb 2012. We were initally concerned about the single room (called "budget room" by the Hotel) and were delighted with the small but well appointed room reserved for my Mother. The service team, from the front desk, to housekeeping, restuarant & bar and especially the concierge, was friendly, helpful and informative. Recommendations for cafes & restuarants, direction on the easiest way to get to the Lowu shopping centre, were provided promptly. The staff even told us when the weather turned cold one morning, so that we were adaquately dressed for going out. The hotel is 10 mins away from Time Square, if we walked slowly. We especially enjoyed passing through the colourful local wet market each day on our way out and back. The breakfast included as part of our room price was adequate. There was small variation on the food choices each day. I had free wireless access, although I had problem accessing it from my room. Basic toiletories (shampoo, shower gel, soap, nail file, cotton buds, tooth brush and tooth paste) were provided. We were given disposal shaver when we asked our friendly chambermaid. The rooms were amazingly quiet, even though the hotel was located at a pretty busy location. Overall, I think this hotel offers good value for money. I would not hesitate recommeding the hotel to my family and friends, and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, acceptable room service”
Reviews.Author: wennitiong
Reviews.Content: Location of this hotel is between the Causeway bay and Wan Chai. By foot, it is about 10 minutes away to the nearest Causeway Bay MRT station and the Times Square. It is quite convenient for shopping in Causeway Bay. For business trip, it is only 5 minutes driving distance from the hotel to the Hong Kong Convention and Exhibition Centre. The accessibility of public transport to other parts of Hong Kong also very convenient. For example, just right in front the hotel, there is a bus stop for bus ride to Central Jetty, Sheung Wan, etc. If not, you may also can take the Tram to access to various spots, in which the station just 3 mins from the hotel. They have quite a number of Sushi restaurants nearby. For the room, yeah, it is quite spacious as compared to one i went last year. Room is quite clean, although old. Remember to request for business floor between 15-20 and non-smoking room. The only downside of the hotel is they do not provide complimentary drinking water. Other than that, this is quite a nice 3-star hotel in Hong Kong.

Reviews.Title: “This is a review of the Signature floor”
Reviews.Author: Amac27
Reviews.Content: I booked my room via Asiarooms and when the taxi pulled up outside the Charterhouse I thought I was the victim of a bait and switch. I stayed at the Charterhouse before with a friend on a tight budget and our room was cramped with very dated fittings and uncomfortable beds. I had no desire to stay there again if I could possibly help it. The Signature floor really is a hotel within a hotel. Everything about it is better, from the funky modern decor to the thought that has gone into the amenities in the room. I was particularly pleased to have an iPod jack that was hooked up to the TV and a shower that offered rain, body spray and hand held shower heads. The bed deserves a special mention - a Sealy mattress with high thread count sheets and pillow cases. They even offer different pillow options! For full disclosure you should understand that my room had no natural daylight, but the views in the Wanchai/Causeway Bay area are not exactly panoramic and the hum of the air conditioning was enough to block out the very limited external noise even though the Signature floor is only two floors above ground level. The room was not huge but somehow the addition of a few vital feet of space left me without the shoebox feel of my previous experience of another floor in this hotel. The sports bar in the basement can be a fun place to watch Premiership or Six Nations matches but I found the prices a little steep. If I had to find a minor irritation it would be that the free wifi keeps on dropping out and requiring you to search for it again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but not great”
Reviews.Author: LolsT
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business and as i was travelling alone i booked a single room which turned out to be the size of an average boat cabin bedroom. The room was small, old , smelt of smoke and the windows were nailed down. The service was ok but not great as was the food. Location was good but NOT within walking distance of the convention centre as advertised.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but...”
Reviews.Author: Foodtripper101
Reviews.Content: Still in the charterhouse while writing this review. Rooms were reasonably priced for causeway bay area but when we got the bill we were surprised by 10% additional service charge to the room charges. Also when we asked yesterday if the breakfast was included, both the front desk officer and concierge said that it was. However upon eating we discovered that an additional HKD 99 per head was charged. A little misunderstanding since we dont speak cantonese. although more people in HK speak english than other parts of China, knowing a few phrases in cantonese would immensely help. The staff however were friendly accomodating. We usually asked them to write down the names of our destinations in chinese so we could show them to the cab driver. The rooms though small and a little dated were clean with a tub in the bathroom. However my parent's room although designated non-smoking reeked of smoke so they asked to be transferred. Location is good. The front desk officer said that wifi was absent in our floor 13th, but we did manage to connect now and then at high speeds. It was free and accessible in the lobby. The nearest MTR station at times square building is about a 5-10 minute walk through a wet market which was filled with live and fresh seafood and fruits. It was our first time to stay at the hong kong side of hong kong and although we missed familiar shops at the kowloon side, we found this area to be newer, with more tourists and more exensive shops. But this is just my opinion. So we scheduled a day to visit tung chung before we leave for hopefully cheaper shopping :). We ate lunch at the famous crystal jade restaurant at 3pm at IFC mall and found it packed. The xiao long bao, a pork dumpling eaten with red vinegar and ginger is definitly a must try. Water is not usually served in restaurants especially along the street so unless you bring you own, be prepared for the staple hot water or tea. I learned that "mixed meat" dish actually consists of innards, seafood, sausages and tofu... but actually quite tasty. So for the less adventurous gourmands, stick with chicken or beef :) or try mcdonalds which i learned serves soup and red bean pie too for dessert. February is a wonderful time to visit since the weather is still cool which is my excuse to don my leather jacket and boots, a treat for someone who lives in the tropics! As for the charterhouse, try it out but keep my advice in mind :) and try to get a mountain view room for a better experience. Till my next review!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: mikecudgen
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at The Charterhouse Hotel whilst staying for 4 nights in Hong Kong on vacation. As it was our first stay in Hong Kong we were not sure what to expect but the accommodation was excellent for our vacation. The rooms are not large but definitely adequate. The location was perfect for us and very affordable. Only minutes by taxi from the train station, easy to catch transport. Staff very helpful and both my wife and I walked around the area late at night without a worry. Breakfast is the only meal we had at the hotel, which was a banquet. Western and Eastern tastes were catered for and not expensive. We travelled daily and location was perfect for us, as is quiet area but only minutes walk to the hustle and bustle of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Not friendly, bad service- left our luggage outside”
Reviews.Author: pie871
Reviews.Content: my boyfriend and i stayed at the charter house for 4 nights, we didnt find the staff very friendly, or warm, the foyer smelt so strong of pot pourri it was quite irritating, however the worst part was that when we asked them if they could store our luggage after check out, so we could walk around for a few more hours before out flight( which was at midnight), we were horrified to find they had left ALL OUR LUGGAGE IN THEIR DRIVEWAY, including my handbag with my passport in it. I was so shocked, it was a few meters easily in view of the main street Wan Chai Rd .. NEVER staying here again.. be careful.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: hlst
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Charterhouse for 3 nights in January. Overall we found the hotel very impressive and a good 3 star base to explore Hong Kong. The location was very good in between Wan Chai and Causeway Bay MTR stations. We found it easy to get to by train from the airport. There was an excellent street market nearby with local produce and lots of fresh seafood. The room and bed was comfortable and clean and we had a lovely view of the mountains. We did not have an issue with noise, there was little to no street noise in the room we stayed in on the 15th floor. We didn't find the room to be too small, we had 4 suitcases and managed to have enough room to be comfortable. The only negative would be the smell in the lobby and the room - it smelt a bit musty and covered with air freshener. But we would definitely stay here again and recommend it to the mid-range traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: Paula O
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conviniently located between Wanchai and Causeway Bay. I stayed for 3 or 4 nights. The place is clean and comfortable, good value.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and Best Location”
Reviews.Author: J B
Reviews.Content: We stayed for our wedding in Hong Kong for 3 nights and were recommended to stay in the Charterhouse. Good service, great location in Wanchai and a great breakfast buffet. Our VIP room was clean and well maintained. The cleaning service was prompt and very effiecient. The only downside in my view is the tv programme selection they offer. Very poor indeed. No propper news channel (BBC or CNN). All in all it was a very good stay and yes would probably stay in the Charterhouse again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and value at CHARTERHOUSE!”
Reviews.Author: vikki l
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at Charterhouse for 5 days and I would like to compliment the training department for training the hotel staff to show outstanding hospitality to all guests. Provis who mans the concierge is ever friendly and showed total dedication providing answers to all our queries. Rooms are very clean and have a strong hot water flow for showers. Charterhouse location is excellent, a mere 5 min walk from Times Square. To get there, I cut through the market and even got some sweet fruits! Charterhouse is a place I would definitely stay again!:)

Reviews.Title: “Good value and well located”
Reviews.Author: Wilsonators
Reviews.Content: Stayed after a long flight. Its an amazing location and easy to get to the best locations. Service and staff were first class but the rooms are a little dated. That said, I would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean Hotel for good value in downtown Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: suimarkswiss s
Reviews.Content: The Charterhouse is nice and clean hotel in the heart of Hong Kong. It is easy to reach, though you need to know where it is located to actually find it. Service is nice and efficient. For Business people definitely a good spot to plan with when you are in Hong Kong. Next time I will try it with the family.

Reviews.Title: “The room was small and dusty”
Reviews.Author: Seekone
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights here and it was just so so. I paid around 170 USD per night, thus making the small dusty room tolerable. I stayed on the 20th floor and got no view. One good thing was the location being near to Times Square and Causeway Bay MTR. The breakfast was 88 HKD and it was crappy. Cant believe someone wrote that it had great food here in one of the reviews. The bathroom was decent though. The maids REALLY NEED to VACUMM these rooms!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Central hotel with good breakfast buffet”
Reviews.Author: lindy5
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 4 nights, pleased with location and standard of rooms (although a bit small). Good breakfast buffet

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location - wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: flsaints
Reviews.Content: Slightly on the small side but excellent for resting. Breakfast buffet was included and was quite good. Location is convenient to major shopping areas. The staff was friendly and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Acceptable stay - handy location”
Reviews.Author: MaverickRoss
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 7 nights in October this year. Making a choice of Hotel in Hong Kong is quite tough as the Price vs. Size ratio is a bit crazy! That being said The Charterhouse is very good value compared to those around it. Check In: We arrived late in the evening (9:00pm) so had no delay or waiting time for check-in. Only problem was that the lady who served us told us our room rate included Breakfast each morning, however next morning when we arrive at the Breakfast they said "no it does not, and we wouldn't have said it does" - I wasn't in the mood to get into an argument so just walked out and found breakfast at one of the many bakeries nearby. Bit sad to start a 7 night stay with that king of situation. Room: We were in a fairly high room, I can't remember the exact number but we were on the 2nd top floor so had a nice view out towards the Happy Valley Racecourse. Ok I don't think anyone can go into HK thinking that the cheap rooms are going to give you a massive spacious area! That said there was "enough" space for us, we had 2 suitcases + 2 carry on bags and it was a bit tight. Bed: Was comfortable enough, pillows could do with being replaced I think they are getting a bit old Fittings: It looks like the room has been modernised lately because most of the switches and controls didn't work, and you kind of had to play a guessing game each night to work out which switch turned off the lights. TV Reception was appalling, would bounce between terrible and shocking - I think in 7 days we had maybe 30minutes of actual clear TV reception, but I can look past that. Bathroom: Not as tiny as I expected but still pretty small, shower and bath combined, the water was a bit of a guessing game, bounced between cold and scalding. Location: Well that is the saviour for this hotel, it is smack bang between Wanchai and Causeway Bay MRT station, little bit of a walk the hotel say 5-10minutes, I would suggest this is at 2am in the morning because every day it took us about 20 minutes fighting the foot traffic. Lots of Restaurants nearby to get some good food - new little Turkish joint across the road did some very good food (cheap). The other benefit about the location is that most Taxi Drivers know it and the road it is on, our friends stayed at a different hotel and had lots of trouble trying to explain where their hotel was. We just jumped in and they knew the hotel. Overall: Look there are a few areas where the hotel desperately needs to update which did drag down my impression a little bit. Overall staff were kind of attentive to our needs (apart from the first mix up on checkin). Next time I come to Hong Kong I might try to find a better hotel, but for the price this place was quite acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for reasonably priced hotel, not great”
Reviews.Author: petaloudamm
Reviews.Content: The area is not all that clean or pretty compared to central or admiralty areas. It is conveniently located, but there is still lots of walking to do for either WanChai or Causeway Bay MTR stations. Overall, breakfast was fine, nothing spectacular. Friendly and service-oriented staff. The bed was short and the room was tiny, but that's a general issue in HK anyway. Very poor quality TV in room. I would stay here again for low(er) cost hotel option, but would not if I could afford better.

Reviews.Title: “Standard business hotel, small rooms, nothing exceptional”
Reviews.Author: Alastair2
Reviews.Content: Standard business hotel, some rooms very small (but that is Hong Kong for you), OK restaurant, service fine. Not exceptional in any way but OK for a few nights.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with great location and excellent hospitality and service”
Reviews.Author: laysee c
Reviews.Content: It was a rush trip but the hotel has offered me a great room with excellent hospitality to rest and get away from the hassle and bustle of work. It is less than 10 minutes walking distance to the shopping mall or to the MTR station where I can get through Kowloon and HK island easily. The hotel staffs there are friendly and helpful. I was impressed with the services I found there. The hotel looks small but the hospitality and services offered are wide and big. Highly recommended to anyone who will travel to HK. =)

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value”
Reviews.Author: Eva L
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in December 2010. This hotel is efficient, very convenient location and probably the cheapest of all hotels in this area. The room is small( even for me and I am a petite woman.) The hotel staff is friendly and efficient. Although it is called Chartered house Causeway Bay, but it's really in WanChai. I grew up in HK so I know the area well. It's 3 mins to Time square shopping center where there's a City Supermarket and a food court in the basement, convenient for western tourist. There are several 24 hours convenience store, numerous small restaurant and bakery. About 10 minutes walk to the center of Causeway Bay, the shopping mecca. Turn left when you come out of the hotel, you'll be in Wanchai in about 10 mins. There are several discount stores for overstock export garments, sometimes you can find some good bargains. The MTR (subway) is about 10 mins away in either direction ( Causeway bay or Wanchai). You don 't need to have breakfast at the hotel, be adventures, try one of the many small places nearby. Although the hotel restaurant does have a good deal on lunch or dinner buffet as well. I am generally happy with the hotel. We got a room near the elevator, in the morning the cleaning ladies emerge from the cleaning supply room next to the cleaning supply room can be quite loud. Other than that, I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who doesn't want to spend a fortune on a room.

Reviews.Title: “A charming old hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jsilva79
Reviews.Content: The hotel interior is Hong Kong of the fifties and sixties but well kept the standards and the service is still impeccable. Near the MTR and you to walk through a public market which adds to being in old Hong Kong. Breakfast was great. The cleaning ladies were all bubbly and the room was fixed up well.

Reviews.Title: “Good small hotel with very small rooms”
Reviews.Author: aschneider703
Reviews.Content: My room was very small, but since I had it to myself, it was fine. The room was very quiet, had nice room darkening shades and a small refrigerator. The shower had great water pressure. There is wi-fi available for a price in the Lobby. Since I was part of a group, I don't know whether the hotel was a good value or not for the money. The hotel is in close walking distance to the subway, an interesting local market, as well as Times Square, which contains many restaurants and shops. The bed was extremely soft and I felt that it was sagging in the middle. This was quite noticeable after spending almost 3 weeks in mainland China, where the beds were all as hard as rocks. There was a nice breakfast buffet with both Chinese and Western choices.

Reviews.Title: “Great responsive service”
Reviews.Author: SefLam
Reviews.Content: I am a travel agent based in Hong Kong and recently booked a friend (and client) in this hotel. He had originally asked for another hotel in Kowloon side but changed his mind to Charterhouse when we offered this. The hotel handled my booking very efficiently and promptly and gave quick replies to all my questions (internet? early check in, etc) Because my friend was flying from San Francisco to Hong Kong and arriving very early 0630, I thought to ask for early check in - which the hotel promised to try their best - depending on occupancy that day. As it turned out, he was able to check in that morning - and very appreciative that the hotel understood that after a long flight, an early check in is a real blessing. His departure on 11 October was early flight 0800, meaning he has to be in the airport about 0600. As his travel agent, I asked the hotel is they can give him a boxed breakfast with a drink and they very nicely did this also. At no point did they quibble about the cost of early check in or boxed breakfast and drink! Nowadays when airlines nickle and dime clients, it is so refreshing and heartening to know that there are hotels like The Charterhouse in a financial centre like Hong Kong- who treat their guests like human beings - needing rest and needing a bit of food!! Thank you to the GM and his staff at The Chaterhouse for treating our client like a human being. In fact, he was treated like royalty!!

Reviews.Title: “The smallest room what I have ever...”
Reviews.Author: Gigik777
Reviews.Content: Quit good location for the shopping, but very small rooms. I have booked 1 single room which was smallest room what I have ever. Even IBIS has much more rooms. Cleaning of the room just soso... Required price even without breakfast really horrible - 1576 HK$. very overpriced hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Halloween time”
Reviews.Author: lyagywonok
Reviews.Content: End of October is Halloween time so the hotel was decorated with different bogeymen in the lobby and restaurant. We didn't book a room beforehand and rack rate offered by receptionist was convenient (even some discount was applied). Hong Kong hotels are not cheap so the price is important argument here. Good start indeed. Pros: - excellent location within Causeway Bay, close to subway station and only easy tram ride to Victoria Peak; if you are not fond of taxi, you don't actually need it; - breakfast was pretty good and included in rate automatically. Cons: - hotel interior looks a bit dated as well as room furniture, but it adds charm and the historical feeling; - the bar on the basement floor is worth visiting but could be fully booked by Liverpool fans on Saturday night during Premier league matchday. Nothing you can do but to look for another place to watch football. No real concerns, hotel serves its purpose. This hotel is just not suitable if you are looking for some luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, ok room”
Reviews.Author: NiciSt
Reviews.Content: Location is very good. Within walking distance to many restaurants, shops etc. About 10min walk to the metro station. Breakfast was good if not great. Room: we chose a suite room because we were travelling with our daughter and needed two separate rooms. The room does not really deserve the name suite but it suited our needs. For the price in HK its ok. I think they have very old rooms (like ours) and some which have been renovated but which are also more expensive. If you dont care about new furniture and style its certainly a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: lazylisa
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of our Travelsphere Tour - this was the last leg of our trip. The hotel is in a great location. Local shops on the doorstep, great bakers, bus stop outside and literally 5 minute walk to Times Square and all the hustle & bustle of shops and restaurants. Just around the corner is a great pub - The Derby - good food & drinks (happy hour 7 to 9). Also if your are lucky enough to be there when the Happy Valley Races are on, you must go, only 15 minute walk from hotel. Also across the road is a foot massage place, great little find only £8 for 45 mins. The room was a little small but we didn't need anything bigger. It was clean and tidy. Only thing I would say was that the fridge did give off a funny smell, not all the time. Breakfast was pretty good, worked out about £7 so ok if you didn't fancy finding somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located”
Reviews.Author: pam1948
Reviews.Content: Stayed on a room only baisis. This hotel was clean but the rooms were small. Towels were changed daily. Air-con. worked well but was rather noisey when on full. Staff were friendly and most obliging. Breakfast was expensive - McDonalds just down the road! Drinks in the lounge were also expensive. Television only had American channels - Fox and Europsport - needed Sky as it became repetitive. All in all a good clean hotel, would recommend but would attempt to have breakfast included at a good and reasonably priced rate.

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: mclaire_1964
Reviews.Content: The last time I stayed at this hotel was when I was still single. So when my family decided to go to Hongkong last March, I thought we should stay at this hotel again, as my memories of this place were quite nice...warm staff and best of all, very reasonable rates. I was not disappointed at all. The people were as warm, friendly and accomodating as before. Their rooms are even better, and the reasonableness of their rates remain. Their buffet breakfast is also quite good. It's also not too far from public transport. My family, including the kids enjoyed our stay there. If you're ever in Hongkong and like a good/comfortable hotel to stay in, without having to feel you're being robbed, check this place out.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and hope to return”
Reviews.Author: MrandMrsCoo
Reviews.Content: Having researched this hotel on the internet I was quite anxious at what we would find! The room we had was clean, comfortable and well equipped ( UK plug sockets are v. handy!) It has a great location right on the edge of a chinese market and only a short walk to times square for upmarket shopping/eating. The MTR (subway) is in Times square and trams are at the end of the street. We chose to use the bakery across the road(there are several nearby) for breakfast and found it delightful and cheap-tried several items from ham and cheese to peanut butter and pineapple(try it it is much nicer than it sounds!!) All staff were friendly and helpful. My only complaint would be that the room had an air of faded charm (i.e in need of updating) Hope to return again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and comfy rooms”
Reviews.Author: mapglobal2
Reviews.Content: Hong Kong was selected as the location for a 10 day birthday celebration for a loved one and the Charterhouse was the base beginning on August 20, 2011. It bills itself as Charterhouse, Causeway Bay, but actually, it's in Wan Chai, although C-Bay is very, very close. Getting right to it, I loved staying there. The room was quite fine, as you can see from the pics, and the location is excellent. You can walk to C-Bay in mins, Central (if you want a slightly longer walk), and even Soho if you are really in a walking mood. You can also catch buses like the 11 (to Central Piers) or the 111 (to Macau ferries) right outside the door. Or, you can go one block over to Hennessey to catch a tram (the price for trams went up to 2.30 from 2.00 recently, but still a great bargain. It can be very crowded during the days on the weekends as all the foreign domestic helpers have their mandatory days off and have to leave the house). One thing was a bit of a pain was that the refrigerator didn't work very well and as there weren't any ice machines on the floors we had to order ice whenever we wanted something really cold to drink. Late at night there was always a strange little guy who brought the ice up and always tried to come into the room, as he didn't want to just hand over the ice bucket, but wanted to pour the ice in ours. Not a problem, but don't just try and bust into the room. But that does not detract much from my overall impression, however. The room was comfy, the bed was excellent, the free wired internet was fast. Added to that the fact that the location was great...hey, you won't go wrong. In HK you've got many, many options. From dodgy hostels on Paterson St. in C Bay and on Nathon in Kowloon to swanky places on both the HK and Kowloon side. I can say that I've stayed in every range and type of place in HK having journeyed there many times, but I would say that Charterhouse is a nice middle of the range place. I think you get a good bang for your dollar there. I would not mind to stay there again. If you go, get a room on the business floor and I think that you'll be just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Strategic Location but not value-for-money!”
Reviews.Author: KelvinPg
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on a slope. About 7 to 10 minutes to Exit A Causeway Bay MTR which is also Times Square. The service was acceptable. The bell boy approached us to ask whether we needed a cab right after we checked out. We stayed at 11th floor. The lift was kind of old and small. The room was clean but very small. The air con was not cold. We paid HKD 1100 per nite for a twin room. Wired broadband internet in the room was free-of -charge.No breakfast included.Hong Kong offers variety of breakfast anywhere.So, breakfast inclusive in the room package is not necessary.Mostly Asians stayed in this hotel.Money changers around here do not offer rate as good as those near ferry terminal.The best rate comes from Lo Wu, as I noticed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for business, shopping and nightlife”
Reviews.Author: tourismplanner
Reviews.Content: The Charterhouse is located in Causeway Bay next to its bustling shopping district and no more than a few minutes walk from the bars and restaurants of Wanchai and the offices of Central.

Reviews.Title: “reasonable value in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: RMS1974
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for the Rugby Sevens in March. The hotel was one of the few in Wanchai not to push their rates up to silly amounts for the tournament weekend. The location is pretty good for access to Wanchai and all public transport links (ten minutes to the MTR or trams, fifteen minutes to the Star Ferry). The rooms are typical for Hong Kong - small! But they are clean. The beds are OK, if a bit hard. We didn't eat or drink in the hotel - there are loads of restaurants and bars nearby to choose from. There is free Wifi in the lobby area.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but worth the price”
Reviews.Author: LiDenise
Reviews.Content: I stayed at that hotel after a bad experience at a Kowloon hostel. A friend was staying at the Charterhouse so we moved there. We were desperate to find a place because there were no room available at other hotels, or it was very very expensive. So we decided to stay at the Charterhouse. The price was expensive but definitely worth it. Well, we received an upgrade to the 2nd floor. It was amazing! After we asked our friend that was staying at the 9th floor, seems like the second floor is almost new. The rooms are small but comfortable, the bathrooms the same. The girls from the reception area were very polite and kind. Generally all the service was more than excellent. About the location of the Hotel, it's near two metro stations and the Times Square mall which I recommed you to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, terrible smell.”
Reviews.Author: schizoniuz
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure how other hotels in HK smell, but this hotel needs to improve its ventilation system if it insists on having most of its floors allotted for smoking rooms. Everything stank and I'm sure the smell even reaches the top floors. I have stayed in other hotels with smoking rooms but it wasn't as bad. The hotel itself has a great location, easy to walk to bus stops (there is even a stop right in front of it) and MTR. The rooms are a bit small but okay enough considering the price and location, water pressure is very good, and housekeeping is somewhat consistent (somewhat because we sometimes had to call twice for our requests). The mini-fridge in our room barely worked, and the switches for the bedlamps did not work so we had to unscrew the hot lightbulbs to turn them off. All in all, what makes this hotel good is the location. However, because of the stink, I would highly advise against staying here if you're traveling with infants or children.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but.........”
Reviews.Author: Patricia032
Reviews.Content: We have this hotel as the last leg of a Travelsphere China tour with Hong Kong add on in April. We were allocated a room on the 5th floor that stench of smoke. As in our request we asked for a non smoking room they changed us to another room on the 15th floor. Still with smell of cigarettes. The staff was very polite but the hotel has seen better days. The room was very small with 2 small twin beds. So we had to put our luggage on the floor and step over it every time we need to go to the bathroom our out of the room. Unfortunately the beds were ridden with bed bugs, so and we were bitten all over, and as the luggage was left on the floor we brought them to England with us. SO once at home had to fumigate the bags and my bedroom carpets as well!. The location is very good, just 5 minute walk either way to the MTR. Just 2 minutes away there is a local market where you can get delicious fruit. On our departure the concierge offer to post some post cards which had Chinese stamps on. As he wasn’t sure if it was the right stamp we left him 20 Hong Kong dollars to add on so the post cards will arrive to England. As the weeks pass on and the post cards did not arrived we develop a sour taste in our mouth, thinking that he pocketed the money and got rid of the post cards. Well the post cards finally arrived on 15 July (since April) and only with the Chinese stamps. Therefore we were right the concierge pocketed the money. All in all a bit disappointed of the travelsphere choice. Every member of our group was bitten by bed bugs….

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything, great service”
Reviews.Author: Zara-loves-to-Travel
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a holiday where we stayed at the Charterhouse Causeway Bay. The service people were great and were prompt with taking our luggage and taking us to our room. A special mention to the young doorman. He was absolutely excellent and I wish we'd told management about his great work. Always asked how your day was and did everything he could to help you out :) We were upgraded to a business room which was very nice! The room was a little small, but it had everything you needed. Bathroom was clean and the room had a coffee counter, desk, flat screen TV and great bed. Overall we were very happy with the hotel and it was so conveniently situated - only a ten min walk to the MTR station and surrounded by lots of local attractions!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but..........”
Reviews.Author: owls9383
Reviews.Content: Date selection stopped at August 2010. An overdue review : Actual trip February 2009. This review goes hand-in-hand with the one just submitted for Regal Riverside, Shatin. And for the record, I'll also do one last one for Stanford Hotel in Mongkok because I stayed at all 3 hotels for that one trip in February 2009. This was the 3rd hotel which I stayed (2nd was Stanford) for my trip in February 2009. Part of this splitting up was so that I could sample as many hotels as I can. The hotel itself is not very visible from the main road but taxi drivers are aware. Reasonable sized (not large) foyer, bright and welcoming with small area with seats for guests . A quick check-in and I was shown to my room down a rather narrow corridor. Although I like having rooms near staircases (less noise disturbances from traffic coming from lifts), this was disappointing. My room was very small with a single bed (set up next to the wall so you can only sit on one side). Writing desk (parallel to the bed with probably 3feet space between), corner cabinet with tea/coffee facilities and a little tv on the top shelf. I queried at front desk regarding the size of the room and was told quite frankly that this is what ALL standard room are supposed to be. What the......??? I have to leave my luggage on the floor and side-step each time I go to the bed. Bathroom and toilet are combined. Just sufficient room to do a 360degree turnaround. Airconditioning was ok but what really upset me was the smell of cigarettes on bedsheets . I wasn't happy about it because I did specify non-smoking when I booked on the internet. The whiff of cigarettes was quite noticeable as I entered the room and I thought it should dissipate by the evening and it did but little did I realise that by the time I went to bed, the bedcover (or quilt) still has it. I rang room service to complain but nothing was done about it. I DEFINITELY AND DID SPECIFY THIS ON MY FEEDBACK FORM TO THE HOTEL when I checked out. Apart from that, I didn't bother trying any of their inhouse restaurants, bar or coffee shop when there're plenty down the road at Times Square. The on-duty concierge was friendly though and the housekeeping lady was helpful as well. Location wise, this is actually quite good cause 10minute walk brings you to Times Square and MTR in the basement. . On the way you'll discover 2 lanes of open-air stalls selling fresh fruits, veges, meats and seafood. Popular with locals living around there and I like this sort of exposure.. In a nutshell, I definitely will not return to this hotel . .

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.... great location.... great room.....great service.....great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: taxtracker
Reviews.Content: Inexpensive hotel, close to Times Square Mall, Metro, Star Ferry, markets and lots of restaurants on Hong Kong Island. The rooms are clean, spacious with lovely bathrooms and comfortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: fakenz
Reviews.Content: Overall we were happy with our stay at the Charterhouse Hotel in Hong Kong. Check in was friendly and quick and we were lucky to have a free upgrade to the newly refurbished floor. We found our room to be a good size, stylish and modern with comfortable beds and pillows and the shower amenities were excellent. The Charterhouse has free internet in the rooms. We were also happy with the TV which had a reasonable selection of English channels. Breakfast was included in our rate and there was an adequate selection of options for the Western traveller. The location was convenient. It is close to the Times Square shopping centre, Star Ferry terminal and Wan Chai train station. The onsite Champs sports bar was also handy as we enjoy watching a bit of sport on TV. The Charterhouse provided excellent value for money and would recommend to anyone, so long as you get to enjoy the refurbished rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Costlier but near to citi centre”
Reviews.Author: raj1808
Reviews.Content: We arrived early morning so staff had a room ready earlier than normal check in time, facilities were great, The hotel is nice with the great location. Rooms are very small and compare to facility price is high. Room service is good ,and food quality is fine. Rooms are having wifi but on free. Receptionist is good in english Close to MTR & bus services, markets close by, staff were very efficient, would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very old hotel”
Reviews.Author: brielle0875
Reviews.Content: Don't get over excited about the lobby pictures..the lobby its very nice but the rooms are very old and dated. First room that we got on the 10th floor it was very bad, not only that the furniture was dated, the carpet is paper thin, and the worst thing was the dirt all around the room. The window shades from cream were grey, there were holes in the walls were the water sprinkler were...the bathroom was very bad . I couldn't stay in that room ...I don't know how they can rent such a thing. They gave us another room on the upper levels which was a little bit better considering the cleanliness, but the same old furniture and bad carpet. The manager was pretty nice about changing the room but probably he knew the condition of the room. The staff in the lobby are just crazy about your carryone bags, they jump in the next second they see you and try to get luggage frm you to store it under the stair case, I understand the lobby needs to look nice with no bags arround but give me a minute..maybe I want to go outside with my bag. The location I think is the best thing of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: oet13
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located not far from wan chai station which is about 5 mins walk. The area is good for a little shopping and restaurants arent far from the hotel. The room is small, i got twin bed (no problem with it). The bathroom is clean with all toiletries. When we got there in the evening, there wasnt any complimentary teas or coffees but the staffs were very helpful and delivered it to us. The bad thing is the internet isnt free (whislt its stated in their website its provided). Overall im satisfied with this hotel coz really i mostly was out on the day and came back in the evening..

Reviews.Title: “The Best Bed and Pillows”
Reviews.Author: Alexa0302
Reviews.Content: Of all the hotels I've stayed, the Charterhouse Causeway Bay has the best bed,comforter, and pillows. The mattress and beddings seemto hug your body and you can really sleep soundly. I also love the free wi-fi anywhere in the hotel and the danish breads in the compli breakfast.The hotel has to be maintained though as I experienced fluctuating power and a/c drips near the bathroom but these were all attended immediately. The room is quite small and you have to order tv programs to be able to watch.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay but be careful of hotel's property in your room”
Reviews.Author: Traveller4567_55
Reviews.Content: Everything of the hotel is good but the only thing I was not happy when we checked out was that we were charged $90 for borrowing a travel adaptor for 3 nights! (even we return the borrowed one to them) The hotel reception said that the adaptor that is for sell in the room we stayed in had disappeared on the first night of our stay. we had no idea where it's gone. Once we got back home, we doubled check in case maybe someone would like us to buy might have put it in our luggages but we can't find. It's not the matter of money since it is only $90 but it's about the negative experience toward this as we didn't take it. So if you stay in this hotel, you have to monitor what has disappeared every night you get back into the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for the price”
Reviews.Author: jylin
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean and stylish, and the staff were very friendly. It's also an extremely good location, and it's also only 3 minutes walk from the MTR. all of this at a very reasonable price, would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable as an old pair of slippers”
Reviews.Author: jamaicaexpert
Reviews.Content: My family including a small boy all enjoyed a two weeks' stay. We occupied two rooms. The staff were all pleasant and helpful, the buffet breakfast was adequate. No complaints, compliments are due. The "Champs Bar" in the basement will appeal to sports fans, in fact the Charterhouse is a major lodging for visiting sportsmen. So, why did I not give it four stars when my ratings are so high? It is showing signs of old age with small TV's with no British channels, no radio and no pool. The location is excellent being close to the bus stops, Times Square and Wan Chai market and the cheap and cheerful outlet shops. Restaurants and convenience stores abound.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value”
Reviews.Author: Montekarlo
Reviews.Content: Walking distance from Times Sq & Causeway Bay, good, clean rooms. Hotel generally very quiet and staff very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “ok hotel for few days”
Reviews.Author: PhilippineTraveller
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Charterhouse for 4 days. Arrived around midnight and got an upgrade to the S-floor. Had to carry my suitcase myself to the room, not a big problem but no one of staff offered to do it which is unusual. Rooms are small, as is usual in Hong Kong. My room was on the 2nd floor and was noisy because of the busy road. Bathroom was good, with overhead shower, normal shower and 6 little body showers. Location of hotel is ok, 5 minutes walk from Times Square (you have to walk through the fish and vegetable market which is quit smelly). Bars are nearby. Hotel has a sportsbar (Champbar) with several screens on which different kind of sports can be watched. Restaurant where you have buffet breakfast in morning and buffet dinner in evening is good. Close to subway, other kinds of public transport are in front of hotel (bus) or very near (tram). Also the ferry is not far away.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Garythesurveyor
Reviews.Content: I chose The Chartergouse based on a previous review by a business traveler. The rooms are small but nicely furnished and perfectly adequate, and the service was excellent. Room facilities were excellent and the bed was very comfortable. Breakfast was excellent! The location was also excellent for me, being just a 15 minute stroll from the Conference Centre. For anyone staying one or two nights on a business trip I would recommend this hotel and will definitely use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and functional, reasonably priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: IainDM
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Charterhouse towards the end of March and found it to be a clean and functional hotel. Great staging point for visiting Hong Kong. There are certainly many better hotels, but you would certainly have to pay a lot more for the pleasure of stying in them. Staff where friendly and efficient. Rooms where clean and tidy. Standard double bed with a small TV, bar fridge and desk. Looked out over towards Happy Valley - so was at the back opf the hotel, which is probably the better view than having a forward facing room. Breakfast, which was included was good. Had dinner one night in the Harry's Bar, which is in the basement of the hotel, and it was good - no compliants. All in all a hapy camper and will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Serviced but with no love”
Reviews.Author: Edspicks-passes
Reviews.Content: A Good friend and partner of my wife and I referred us to this hotel as the pricing was fair and always worth to explore and give any hotel a chance since we do visit Hong Kong quite often. This was a New Years celebration for us. Right, now back to the hotel. It was not one of the bigger hotels but fair in size. For the most part it was clean in general. However, certain other aspects were not appealing. For instance, my wife and I are not smokers and we know very well in Hong Kong there are many smokers. Actually, I'm being kind because there are more than many, for some reason I keep on thinking of that Mcdonald's board back in the USA where they keep their running stats outside that says over a billion served. Anyhow, we paid in advance and made sure to request a no smoking room and we even double checked to make sure they had it before we came. When we arrived they took us to our room after check in and you guessed it, was a smoking room. The second we walked in it reeked. So, we politely asked that they change our rooms. At first they told us there where no more but they knew we were not going to settle for less than what we asked for especially since my wife having the nose of a Basit hound, did I spell that write. Anyhow, not a nose that looks like one but she can sense like one no joke. Bottom, line we went to another room and it was actually a queen size bed not a king size as request so they had no choice but to give us an upgrade and this time instead of walking us there they simply gave us the key as if we were trouble or high maintenance guests. So, much for the love on that note. Also, i'm a fairly big guy or pleasantly plump as I like to say. I'm working on the weight now but I am good looking at least. Hope i wasn't arrogant there but anyways the bed was too small but I dealt with it and no complaints on my part as their prices where fair on the per night basis. So, the The second problem was that even though I wanted to watch a movie late at night not porn because they offer that every where in Hong kong in any hotel movie system but the movie would not function and although they agreed to take it out the bill they still charged it to our credit card after we left including charging us for extra nights on our room. So, we had to go through the process of dealing with our Credit Card company in order to have them revert funds this took time and effort out of my wifes time in order to call them and inform including the hotel. Well, we got the cash back but not happy about the cheap shot as the counter guy in the lobby seemed to not be happy about this as we had initially made them delete the charge before we left only to find out they had added it again. Anyhow, they were semi efficient in servicing the guests but left something to desire for a second visit. My visiting them again would only be again if I had limited funds to part with. Anyhow, there you have it. I see this place overall as a choice for first night arrival while you try to find the best hotel for your selves. The pluses on this hotel to be fair is the price as I said is fair, WiFi available free but only in the lobby, movies and restaurants within 10 to 15 minutes walking and not to far from the tram station to Airport. I made the review now you make the call. God Speed.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: Anon100001
Reviews.Content: Charterhouse Causeway is nice 3-4* hotel. Rooms were clean, good size and nice bathroom. However, walls were quite thin and you could hear neighbours. Location is not bad, near the ferry port and central. No complaints, good enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: girishb
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel, not too big not too small but good price nice bar with happy hours in evening at basement good location 5min to wan chai station and just in the Wan Chai market Few amenities however may not be working which is fine cos they will fix it if you ask for it.

Reviews.Title: “Family-like atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: grdwdgrrrl
Reviews.Content: The reception were very patient and friendly, especially with my 5 yr old boy. They couldn't do enough to help and answer questions. We had dinner at Champs and really loved the atmosphere and service. I was travelling with my middle child (the others were at home in China) for a passport problem. It wasn't a pleasure trip but after two days at another grim hotel, this was a breath of fresh air. I loved the location, near markets and shops and real people. Easy access to transport; the MTR was 5 - 10 minutes (Causeway Bay), street tram and bus to Central within 2-5 min. I can't wait to bring my family. I've been to HK many times, and this was by far my most comfortable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Always great to be back with people who make you feel great.”
Reviews.Author: NCIBM
Reviews.Content: Great hotel team who want to look after you, from the moment you arrive until you leave.Nothing to the staff is a problem.My guests have independently returned many times. I will be back in March for the first of 5 or 6 times this year.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money at The Chartered House Causeway Bay”
Reviews.Author: Apollonia_hongkong
Reviews.Content: I recently went to Hong Kong for business trip and stayed in The Chartered House Causeway Bay for 1 night. I got a good deal for a Superior Room at slightly over USD110 net a night which is at least 40% cheaper than a lot of 4-star hotels in Causeway Bay. The room was not big but it was clean and well-equipped. For my business trip, I mainly look for a well-equipped, clean room in a convenient location at a reasonable price, in fact, I sparely spend too long time in the room. One good point about this hotel, the sound proof of the room was good and I could sleep like a log. The location is easily accessbile to various means of transportation, I could easily catch a cab to Hong Kong Exhibition & Convention Centre and Central. Even if I took MTR, it took only 15 minutes from Causeway Way to Central. I did try the buffet dinner in the cafe, Gazebo Restaurant. Out of my surprise, the restaurant provided wide variey of choices in food, from sushi, long clawed crabs, Hainan chicken rice, Cantonese dim sums to curry food. All the staff I met were friendly and courteous. If I come to Hong Kong again, The Chartered House Causeway Bay will definitely be on my selection list.

Reviews.Title: “Skip the Charterhouse. You won't regret it.”
Reviews.Author: Anoop_Anand
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed here. Didn't like pretty much anything about the hotel, from the tacky lobby to the rude employees to the mediocre breakfast and the oh so tiny rooms... you get the point. If you're travelling to Hong Kong, I woud recommend that you budget a little more for your hotel room and skip the charterhouse. Its not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!!!”
Reviews.Author: MahimaAnand
Reviews.Content: Had the worst time EVER! Located in a shady area, rude staff, tiny room. Prior information goes completely unnoticed. Just gonna say... don't do it!!! (Only saving grace, is walking distance to Times Square)

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay.”
Reviews.Author: nbnorway
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for the hong kong fair at the hktdc. Nice location and not far away from the main street and hktdc.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: NipaT
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a signature room in the 2nd floor for one night. The modern style room had a bath room with complimentary bath robes and a very nice rain shower. The wash basin however was just inside the front door, which was a bit odd. The room was a bit worn out, ie. there were some stains in the carpet. The bed was comfortable but some noise from the street woke us up at night. The internet connection was free and worked without problems. Hairdryer was new. Buffet breakfast was included in our rate. There was a good variety of juices, fruits, hot buffet, cold cuts to choose from. The hotel staff was very friendly. It is situated in a good location. There is only some minutes walk to the nearest Causeway Bay MTR station.

Reviews.Title: “Could do better”
Reviews.Author: jusech
Reviews.Content: First, as mentioned by many, the location is not bad. It's in between Wan Chai and Causeway Bay, and within walking distance (10 minutes) of both MTR stations. Convenience stores and eating places abound, so food is never a problem. The problems are the rooms, and small minds. Room first. We are in a signature room. The room is beautifully styled and decorated with clean, modern lines. Every technological convenience for the road warrior is made available. There is even a Krups coffee maker if you should be inclined to brew your own while on holiday. The bathroom is a good size with a wonderful rain shower. Amenities from Giorgio Armani complete the look. All the signature rooms are on the second level, you get traffic noise all the time, day and night. Walls are wafer thin. You can hear the lift go 'ping!', you can hear people walking and talking outside. And it could be part of the style, but the windows are covered by shutters that do not adjust and do not keep out night light. They also do not allow day light in as the glass is completely covered by yellow plastic. It's a weird feeling not to be able to look out and check the weather in the morning. My biggest problem is with the staff. There is a distinct difference in attitude towards the way the staff - even the porters - treated the guests. Asian ones are usually ignored and not offered any help. When we arrived at the hotel for the first time, the suited doorman simply stood and stared as I tried to haul our luggage up the front steps, while carrying my younger child in my arms. This morning, my husband was even stopped from taking a newspaper (one of the complimentary ones) to read at breakfast! While waiting for my husband at the lobby, I gave my 2 and 4 year old children biscuits to eat. One of the concierges/managers (a man in a suit) came and told me, in Mandarin, that they were not allowed to eat in the lobby. Is there ever such a rule in any hotel? We were seated quietly at a corner, not causing any disturbance. When I spoke to him in English asking why, he turned deferential and slunk away.

Reviews.Title: “A small but warm and convenient hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Charron
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is quite good. It is located in Wai Chai Road, which is next to the main street Hennessy Road, where there are tram stations right there. But it is 10 mins walk to the MTR station. Around the hotel there are convenient shops, super market, restaurants, cosmetics & medical store (Mannings), Starbucks...so it is very convenient. The room is petty small, however, unlike other hotels I stayed before, it didn't give me pressure. I think it is because the staff put some efforts on the details in the room. For example, there are tourism coupons in the tourism brochure on the desk. And there is a map of Hong Kong in the drawer too. The only disavantage I think is the internet fee, which is rather high. They have 3 packpages: 30 HKD/30 mins, 120 HKD/24 hours, and 240 HKD/48 hours. Even if we choose the 24 hour one, which can be considered as 5 HKD/hour, however, people won't come to HK and stay in the hotel room just for surfing online for 24 hours! Thus, it would be better if the fee can be waved.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Lagoons
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Charterhouse 2 nights as a stopover from our return from Amsterdam. Our accommodation was on the 13th floor and bed was comfortable with no street or hotel noise. Did not eat at the hotel however restaurant was well patronised. We are aged 60/54 and walked to MTR and ferry with ease. Humidity was high and it can rain heavily so some protection needed. Only drama we incurred at the hotel was at Champs Bar. Watch out for the buy one get one free happy hour promotion. i.e. ask how much the drinks are going to cost before buying. Our error. Otherwise staff were very helpful with very good english in the main. Embarrassing with our chinese a non event. We had an early arrival and late flight home. Hotel was busy and whilst room was not available on our arrival our luggage was stored while we went out for breakfast and we were allowed into our room 2hrs prior to normal check in.

Reviews.Title: “S Signature room”
Reviews.Author: matgray
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Charterhouse a week ago and tried out their Signature Floor. The furnishings were great with the nice soft bed. But the room was so small! I suppose you dont spend much time in your room but I don't like feeling cooped up and I do like a proper bathroom with a basin one of the furnishings. This Signaure room was furnished with the wash basin just inside the front door. Strange? The walls appear to be thin as I was woken at 4 a.m. one morning with groans and moans from the occupants of the next room mating. Location is great, staff nice and value for money good, Free internet plus a few other goodies. But probably won't stay there again because of the tiny rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money, soft bed, good location”
Reviews.Author: cameron66
Reviews.Content: I stay in the Charterhouse often on business, have probably stayed there 10 times over the last 3- 4 years. Essentially, if you are looking for a good value and a good location, it is a decent choice. It is a short 5 minute walk to Times Square, with everything you could want and also the subway. I don't mind staying here because the beds are comfortable (soft) and the water pressure is good. It is also pretty quiet. So you can get a good sleep in this hotel but don't expect amenities. The tvs are tiny and usually get bad reception, they don't get CNN or many other normal international channels, the rooms are mostly pretty worn down as well. The bar in the basement is good and has reasonable prices. This place is also a big China tour group hotel (because its cheap) so you often have 50 people hanging out in the lobby in the mornings. They do have a couple floors that have been renovated. Try get upgraded to those if you have a chance. Anyways, overall it's fine if you're looking for value, a soft bed, and located close to Causeway Bay.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice !!!”
Reviews.Author: rafaelvasel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just few blocks from the CauseWay Bay subway station and the buses to the Ferry stops in front of it. i recommend it !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Money Given Location”
Reviews.Author: Rory K
