Reviews.Content: While rooms may be small, they are well equipped and not atypical of Hong Kong hotel rooms in the mid-range. Location is excellent - very close to Causeway Bay MTR and shopping, walking distance to Government stadium for sports events and with plenty of dining alternatives nearby. Good sports bar in basement. helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “The Charterhouse - Not My Choice”
Reviews.Author: philingfishy
Reviews.Content: Had to fly to Hong Kong for a business trip and decided to try out the Charterhouse hotel since our dealers are around the area (Causeway Bay). Hotel Review - Small hotel - Front office staff seems a bit lost and not very helpful. - Concierge is pretty good and helpful. - Rooms are really small. - Housekeeping staff that did our room had a tendency to smoke in the room. Room smells of stale cigarette smoke every time we returned in the evening. - Rooms are tired. - Beds are too soft for someone with a back that is not so good. - Pillow are really flat. - Television is rather small. - You've got to boil your own water. No complement water. - Use of internet is chargeable. Area / location / Misc. - Good location as it is near some places where one can do some shopping such as Time Square. - Public transport stops right in front. - Cozy sports bar. - Food outlets nearby. - 7-11 nearby. Summary To enjoy your stay; try to imagine that you're staying on board a a cruise ship where the walkway to rooms are narrow, and the rooms are small... well you can call them cabins. Request for none smoking floor (I do not know if the housekeeping staff handling that floor smokes) if you do not smoke. Well, we ran out of options. I will probably not recommend this hotel to friends because of certain essential parts lacking but I've been to worse hotels.

Reviews.Title: “ok location”
Reviews.Author: tazzlimbo
Reviews.Content: Small rooms, nothing special, just a place to sleep. Location is a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Strategic Position to walkabout in Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: NanyHaqiem
Reviews.Content: the hotel is strategically situated in the middle of Wanchai road, so it is easier for traveler such as me to walk to places of attraction because it is quite near to MRT, mini bus stop, city bus stop, taxies and tram...to first timers in Hong Kong, i suggest you use Google Map as your guidance...as for the hotel, not bad to stay in Charterhouse...the service was good and fast...although not many employees who can talk fluent English, their broken English is easy to understand, sometimes...there's no azan in Hong Kong, so muslim must alert the time of prayers...there's a mosque behind the hotel, for muslim who want to come and pray..they also provide halal food in the building with cheap prices and satisfying dishes..

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: FelixOnco
Reviews.Content: I was in this hotel for the New Year cellebrations and I have to say the situation is very good, just 10 minutes walking to Wan Chai pier (Star Ferry) and around 5 to 10 minutes to the MTR (Underground) Station. The bad thing is the rooms are quite small, we were sharing a double and I cannot say we could run the marathon there... Neverthelless rooom are clean, not bad in shape and do their work. Price is not bad either so in the whole I would recommend this hotel if you are looking for a mid-range decent place where to stay. Anyway HK has lots of things to see and do so it would not be wise just to stay in the room because is very nice...

Reviews.Title: “what do you expected with this 3*** hotel?”
Reviews.Author: busbusgedebus
Reviews.Content: the room is too small, even with my little daughter (maybe this room is for single person only) and too old. We only spent 2 night and after that we move to another with more big room...

Reviews.Title: “Looking a bit tired”
Reviews.Author: trixiebear
Reviews.Content: My normal choice for business trips to HK, the Novotel was booked up and was recommended Charterhouse as an alternative. This hotel looks like it was done out in the mid-90's when lots of wood darkish panelling was the in thing then, even there wasn't that much space so it makes things rather dark and opressive. The room I had on the 15th floor was ok, but looking somewhat worn and dated - the upkeep could be better. The room was ok but had definitely seen better days. Sizewise reasonable for this price in Hong Kong. Service in the hotel from what little I saw of it was fine, and its got a good location. Overall not bad, but I'll be back at Novotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Did the job”
Reviews.Author: john_boy1Scotland
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ok . I have been to H/K 10 times and this is the worst hotel I have stayed in there . That’s not to say it was too bad just there are better for little more money . The hotel was well situated . We had a pleasant stay . Only real bad point was the man on reception had attitude his name is Oscar Oscar is not good for this for this hotel I was not alone with this opinion

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: fishmanToronto
Reviews.Content: i stayed at the charterhouse in late feb 09 i really enjoyed my stay great location clean rooms and i had a great view on the south side the staff was helpfull. i have stayed here twice in the last year and would go back next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: s14bus
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Chaterhouse for 3 nights 29th December 2008 to 1st January 2009. a great little budget hotel in a great location. Ideally situated within 20 minutes walking distance to the Harbour, 10 minutes to Times square, convenient for buses, trams & MTR station. The hotel bedrooms are small but clean and the beds are very clean and comfortable. We found the hotel staff to be very courteous and helpful. They serve a great breakfast which was included in the price. Harry's Bar in the basement of the hotel is a great place to start the night and the food there is quite good too. Derek & Pat United Kingdom

Reviews.Title: “Hong Kong fantastic - Charterhouse a bit grim!”
Reviews.Author: Lee1970
Reviews.Content: We knew this was a three star, and were not expecting too much. However, the rooms were grubby, in need of a good clean and a paint job. The service from the front desk was non existent - Although I need to mention that the concierge who booked our sight seeing trips was very polite and efficient. There was a conference on when we were there and we were not allowed to use the breakfast room which was lovely - instead we were sent to the basement which was dire! Never mind - we had an amazing time in Hong Kong as we only used the hotel to sleep in! I have since been told the hotel is getting refurbished bit by bit so maybe in the future it will be ok!

Reviews.Title: “I Like the Charterhouse”
Reviews.Author: tf1803
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel around six times now and have always had an enjoyable time. It is not slap bang in the middle of the Bars/drinking area area which is a good thing and the rooms are comfortable if a little on the small side. Harry's bar is a good place to start the evening, they show all the big football games in The Premiership on their big screens.The food in the bar is not bad either. I have recommended this hotel to various friends who have stayed there and none have any complaints to make about it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Harry's Bar!”
Reviews.Author: TonyBradfordonAvon
Reviews.Content: I am surprised by some of the negative reviews for this Hotel. The only down-side we could find was the location - Wanchai is convenient, but somewhat noisy and crowded (although that is perhaps the point of Hong Kong!). As for the Hotel itself, neither we nor the friends we were travelling with had any complaints. Our room (11th floor) was the size you would expect from a budget hotel and had wooden built-in furniture - wardrobe, desk, credenza. It was immaculate, with fresh towels and bed-linen every day. We had no problem with street noise. Harry's Bar seemed to be about as close as you can get in Hong Kong to an English pub. The dining-room's 'Dining with an Experience' buffet breakfasts and dinners were so good that we soon stopped bothering to look for other places to eat. Helpful English-speaking staff. A very nice hotel, popular with Brits and Australians in particular (at least while we were there).

Reviews.Title: “Good if you like "late night massagy"”
Reviews.Author: krabbenbroetchen
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel only one night ( I needed a visa for China). The quality of the rooms was ok, but the in house "massage salon" called me three times if I don' t want to come down. Probably they saw that I was a single male traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Worse one I've ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: jtang
Reviews.Content: I could say that this is the lousiest hotel that I have stayed at. The worse thing is they don't even provide toothbrush. All the other hotels that I stayed in provide toothbrushes as the most basic item in the bathroom. The bed is hard and the blanket is uncomfortable. I asked for a non-smoking room and was given a smoking room. Thankfully, there was no vomit smell like others mentioned. The hotel does look grand on the outside but definitely not in the room. Its quite a long walk from the MTR station. The only compliments goes to the polite cleaners and some helpful staff who are willing to help. But on the whole, I will definitely not go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS”
Reviews.Author: maria_s32
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week trip from Hong Kong. The location of the hotel is fantastic but it has left me a literal marks on my lower legs due to bed bug bites. Towels are good for cleaning the tables, we were given worn out towel and with a stinky smell.....Never book in this hotel even if the location is good. Will never recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: frozzty
Reviews.Content: my first time in this hotel but not in HK, booked the S floor. First Impression was stunning, the design is very modern and up to date. The S signature studio is a compact very usefull room for traveler like me and my wife. rainshower/massage bath, the 42' lcd TV, broadband connections, and the dvd player makes us spoiled for the 6 nights we stay in this hotel. we feel like in some techy euro small hotels. I recommend to take the S floor, its a new refurbished rooms, as other floors are just plain and old HK hotels designs. Locations is perfect, within walkin distance to time square mtr, but be prepare to walk underneath, cus it is pretty far to get to the MTR itself. I found this hotel perfect because in front of the hotel got this 2 hour laundry, so avoid the hotel laundry, as u know chinese laundry could be depend on and cheap too. And after a long walk of HK they got this foot massage place in front of the hotel for 98HKD/hour, wonderfull. The Computer center is on the left side of the hotel within a short walk, i regret that i bought my laptop in MK, as they say they have branch in wanchai too, next to my hotel. What is not to love about this hotel, i love it. for HK first timer or a returning visitor i recommend Charterhouse hotel, but do book the S floor, its very convenience.

Reviews.Title: “my stayed at hongkong-charterhouse hotel”
Reviews.Author: babyqc
Reviews.Content: My stay at hongkong.Mar.25-28.. charterhouse hotel is located in wanchai area.. this is the middle part of hongkong island (between causeway bay area and central). The rooms are not big but the price is just right ..The location is very convinient to travellers... it is within 20 mins leaisurely walk to hk convention center.. you won't get bored while walking because the area have lots of stores to window shopped... If you take the tram It will cost hk$2.00 from the east to west side of the hk island... It is near Times square (10 mins walk)which is the area for the young and old.. lot's of name brand store and if you walk nearby there's what they called an alley ..for cheapper clothings, bags and stockings.. and I can't forget this place the crystal jade resto which make shiao long bao ...shanghainese steam dumpling very..very delicious the resto is located on the 4th flr of the bldg. you can see this resto it is located just across the tram wanchai stopped.. sorry i'm not fond of taking pictures...Hongkong is a shopper paradise... and lot's of tourist attraction... must see area is the peak.. you take the tram at the central area... and when you are inside the tram you can see the stiffnest of the tram in going up.. and the view deck at the peak is heavenly go at night to have a good view of hk by night with all the bldgs lighted.. upon reaching the airport in Hk their tourist board packet contain evrything a travellers would like to know and a map of the whole island is on hand! I love hongkong this is my 3rd stay at this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: dashan1155
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with the cleanliness of the hotel and the location is just perfect. Stafft at Front Desk and Housekeeping were very attentive and definitely I would fully recommend all who is looking for a good budget hotel. Cleanliness of Hotel room is really good except for the cigarette smell.

Reviews.Title: “ok but check your credit card, i was charged for drinks not used!!”
Reviews.Author: LyndaWokingham
Reviews.Content: I read reviews on this site and chose charterhouse due to it's central location, i was not disappointed with that but other niggles were, i booked 2 rooms, mine was ok, as suggested small but functional, i had to ask for the blanket on my bed to be changed, it didn't look clean, that was done, fine. My other room i booked had a leaking air conditioner which dripped onto the carpet causing a smell and damp/wetness. The bathrooms were basic and old which is not a problem but the black mould living on the mastik all around the sink basin was off putting, towels pretty old with worn marks but clean, but the cherry on the cake was i didn't use the mini bar, i never do, i booked out, no charges, nothing used but got home to find i'd been charged for (on checking with my booking agent) 2 bottles of whisky, i absolutely disputed this and to date have heard nothing, i think giving a month is long enough to prove that they accidentally made an 'error' so i would warn others to check their credit cards and if you don't use a minibar ask for it to be cleared thus not giving them the opportunity to 'boost profits' i'm not out of pocket by a huge amount of money, but i could have been! If you are on your gaurd for this happening (and i have written this review to warn others) i may stay again as the price was reasonable, but i wouldn't leave my credit card open, i wouldn't feel comfortable. I would ask for a quite room, and if the carpet is wet ask to be moved. The breakfast was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “signature rooms are good!”
Reviews.Author: kayfrey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Charterhouse hotel for a week during Christmas 2007 on their Signature floor - our S room was large, clean, nicely styled and perfectly adequate for our weeks stay. the shower and toilet were very funky! The S floor is on the 2nd floor, so you can hear street noise, but in general we didn't find this a problem. they give 2 bottles of complimentary water a day, paper, and fresh fruit on arrival. On the S floor there is also a business centre room where you can use the internet for free. It also has a shower room and toilet which we were able to use whilst waiting for our next flight having already checked out. their fitness centre is small, but has 2 treadmills, 2 cycles, and weight machines. to use the gym, we had to go up the staircase and caught a glimpse of the other floors, which did look a bit dated. hence we are very glad that we upgraded our room to the S floor, as we had no complaints with it, and it is quite cheap for a boutique room in city centre, we know that we wouldn't get that for the same price back home. breakfast was good in that there is something for everyone, i read an earlier review saying that there wasn't cheese available but think cheese for breakfast is not a common thing in hong kong unless you are staying at a huge international hotel. Downstairs we used the champs bar, it was a good place for a drink for the end of the day. Beware the Chelsea fans when they take over the place when chelsea games are shown! lots of footie on - even if recorded games. The location of the hotel is very convienient, once you know where you are going, it's about a 5 minute walk through the wet market to the shops and MTR - causeway bay has the most choice of places to eat and drink in the one area. If you know where you are going, wan chai road is on bus routes anyway, so it's actually very convienient. the staff were very helpful and spoke good english. we recommend the Signature floor rooms of this hotel, and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Catherine_Ursula
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Charterhouse for one night just before Christmas. Have been to HK before so the focus was on eating and shopping this time! The rooms were small but clean and well-arranged. I was only staying one night but I would have been happy to stay for longer. There's lots to do in HK so no need to be in the hotel too much anyway! The beds were quite short - I'm 5ft2 and my feet were over the end ! unless I pushed the pillows right to the headboard - but I think that is standard in Asia. Service was friendly and polite. I was on the 18th floor at the front of the building and there was some street noise, not too much but might be more of a problem on lower floors. For first-time visitors to HK, staying somewhere in Central might be more convenient, but for shopping Causeway Bay is fine. The hotel is a few minutes walk to all the big department stores and close to the MTR. I found the map on the hotel website to be a little confusing and it took me 20 minutes wandering around to find the hotel the first time (I was having grumpy thoughts about the hotel website saying it was 7 minutes walk!) But actually it is really close and I think only took about 5 minutes once I knew the way. Here are my instructions in case they help: - Go to Causeway Bay MTR, take the Times Square exit, and go to the main entrance to Times Square where the big TV screen is. - With Times Square behind you, go left along the street. At the end of the street you will see motorway ramps crossing in front of you. - The street you want is straight ahead, but to cross the motorways you need to go a little to the right (there always seemed to be lots of people doing this, so just follow everyone else). - On the other side, there is a small street continuing ahead, it should be almost directly in front of you. There were stalls selling fruit and fish on both sides when I was there. - Continue along the small street for about 2 small blocks and you will come to a main street with trams crossing in front of you. - Wan Chai Street is straight ahead across the street and the Charterhouse is on the left, about the third building along.

Reviews.Title: “Good location poor room”
Reviews.Author: gingademon
Reviews.Content: We recently spent four nights at the Charterhouse. It was booked as part of a package so I really had no say in the selection of the hotel and I can't comment on the price. I had checked out the reviews before we left and my experience tends to back up what most people are saying. The plus points are its location, being close to Causeway, Wan Chai and Times Square shopping centre. I also found the staff to be polite and helpful. Another plus was the breakfasts, these consisted of a wide choice of western and Chinese dishes, all well presented and of good quality. The bar downstairs was a good place for a drink after a hectic day and also provided good and relatively cheap meals. The big minus point was the room. It was drab and well past its best. The bathroom had mould around the tiny bath, the sink was cracked and worse of all the ceiling dripped water on us. The blankets on the bed were stained as was the wallpaper. Cobwebs were hanging off the ceiling. I did go straight back down to reception and requested another room only to be told that their was no chance as the hotel was fully booked for the next few days. Having said all this we actually spent very little time in the room so it did not affect our stay to any great extent. Hong Kong was a great place to spend a few days but if I do go back I will probaly look for an alternative hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Expect a TWO Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tygerlily
Reviews.Content: During the time of our stay there was some convention going on in Hong Kong so we didn't have many choices. When making the reservation we requested a high floor, nonsmoking, king bed room. They gave us a 6th floor, smoking room with 2 twin beds. They wouldn't change our room and said that they had nothing else available during all 3 nights of our stay. How can that be?! Next, the bathroom was probably the most disgusting I have stayed at. There was mold/mildew within every 4 inches of the grout, there were nails driven into the wall above the toilet paper dispenser, & there was a hole right above the toilet paper dispenser that someone had stuffed toilet paper in. The sheets were really thin (from being old & lots of washings) and I could feel the rough, itchy blanket through the bed sheet on my legs. Almost insignificantly compared to everything else, the lighting was very dim but if it was brighter you might see more of how old this place is. Location is ok. Not right next to the MTR. If you want a better location check out the Wharney Guang Dong although it's on a street that has hooker bars at night (but totally not dangerous).

Reviews.Title: “Good location. Good hotel as a base.”
Reviews.Author: littlesisterWales
Reviews.Content: Not the most modern or luxurious hotel but clean and perfectly adequate. Must have been the bee's knees when it was first opened. Good location for walking to Times Square (5 mins). Bus stops outside. Rooms not huge but they've got everything you need. Excellent buffet breakfast (£5). Polite helpful staff. Great as a stopover hotel but if staying longer than 2/3 nights I personally would prefer a hotel with a swimming pool as after a marathon shop etc it's good to be able to chill by a pool to re-charge the batteries to cope with Hong Kong's hectic pace. Most taxi drivers seemed to know where it was.

Reviews.Title: “Dont stay here”
Reviews.Author: westmorland
Reviews.Content: We were booked into this hotel 'superior room' by our tour comapny- Arrived here late eveing, given room on 5th Floor which we rejected both because of size and cleanliness, walls were filthy, bathroom also, hairs in bath plug, (actually we didnt have a plug, but they brought one to us.) no bedspreads on beds, only stained blankets- Linen although clean had seen better days, grey and with holes. No where to put luggage, escept on the very stained dirty carpet! Were given a second room on 4th floor, equally as bad, and a carbon copy of the first in every respect. but being rather tired of arguing with the duty manager about so called 'superior rooms' we decided we had to accept this one rather then spend our valuable time in HK trying to get a better room. Fortunately we were only staying 2 nights. They appear to be renovating the hotel from the top down. In their favour the dining room was nicely fitted out and fairly clean, however I would not recommend staying here until they finish the renovations, if they ever do !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: johnbexfields
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is in a good location for Hong Kong Island, central etc, lots of bars are close by, and the MTR, the rooms are a bit small, but fine for a lone traveller, clean, tidy, and good value. It is a good compromise on price / location, it has a sports bar to watch English football etc, and there are many more in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “questionable fire safety during redefurbishment”
Reviews.Author: max2020
Reviews.Content: I was put in a room on one of the upper floors. When the lift door opened I was presented with a corridor carpeted with wooden boards and protective cardboard taped to the walls. Worse still THE SMOKE DETECTORS ON THE CEILING WERE TAPED UP (see photo) - I can only assume they did not want the dust from the building work to set the alarms off! I requested another room, but as I had checked in around midnight and the hotel was full they could not do this. The free internet service kept cutting out even after midnight, which was a pain. On the plus side the room was cramped as is usual in HK , but otherwise well appointed. Needless to say I was happy to check out the next morning. When I mentioned the taped up smoke detectors to the receptionist, he just laughed it off. SURELY THERE IS A LAW AGAINST THIS?

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the upgrade”
Reviews.Author: pebblelake
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 10 days on mostly business, so upgraded to the Signature floor due to size of the rooms. ROOMS - quite nice, truly, for the price paid. The mattress was perfect, lots of pillows, the shower area (made for four!) was relaxing with the waterfall and superjets. In-room food counter for your coffee/tea, replenished daily, and fridge for your water, fruits, etc. Very clean, and the maid service was exceptional. Good office space, and a wall to wall sofa for relaxing. There are no shelves or counters, so I kept having to shove items on the very narrow living area shelf. The unfortunate thing is that they developed an upgraded floor one floor above the very noisy street and the hotel's lounge, so if you are there for business and go rest at a reasonable time, bring earplugs. As well, hope your neighbours on either side don't keep you up late as the walls are paper thin. BREAKFAST was included for my fare. Buffet of chinese noodles and dim sum choices, but they tend not to cater to International travelers. No oatmeal or cheese, and basic fruit. For those who enjoy pastries for breakfast, no problem. INTERNET connection kept dropping off making my work very difficult to accomplish. I made sure to check this point ahead of time due to the 12-hour difference with back home, so needed it working at all hours. However, the staff was so very helpful each time I needed it reset. STAFF was pleasant and tried their best to help. ELEVATORS are exceptionally slow, and though I stayed only one floor up, they blocked the stairwell (still unclear why) so had to wait, and wait, and wait... The location is in a very active area, with a short 15 minute walk to my office. Perfect for me. Though there are hotels closer to the office, the tarifs are much higher and they do not have the same local atmosphere as this location. Take in as much as you can - this is an amazing island and the hotel location is a short walk to all kinds of restaurants, local shops and parks, while a cheap taxi ride to all major shopping arcades. Not a bad hotel (S floor!) for the price and local atmosphere. If you're looking for a westernized atmosphere and hotel, this is not the location for you.

Reviews.Title: “deceptive descriptions in expedia and other hotel booking websites”
Reviews.Author: sharky852
Reviews.Content: for the price this place charges, what you get certainly does not match expectations. the photos on the website make it look decent but upon arriving, i found a really small room (even for HK)... but the worse part of it was a very lumpy and non-supportive mattress. the bathroom fixtures were old and very worn looking and the carpet in both the hallways and room were in dire need of replacement. if i had the chance to see the room b4 checking in, i would never have done so. I stayed 1 nite out of the 4 i planned on staying there and quickly checked out in the morning for another hotel. Expedia was nice enough to refund the remaining nites for me so that I wouldn't have to pay for 2 hotels. my advice is to avoid this place. for their accomodations, you may as well go for a hostel.

Reviews.Title: “Compact and very well located”
Reviews.Author: Sweetpeatraveluk
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as part of the far east experience with travelscope. Very very compact, tired bedrooms and bathrooms, but clean and fully functional rooms, 2 tiny beds and very interesting lighting and tv operation on bed head a blast from the British 70's past. Everything was OK and I therefore give an overall 4 as the location won it for me and my husband. It was easy to walk down to the trams, very central and real hong kong, ate in some really interesting cafe just around the corner, did not know what we were eating, but you have to try things once hey ! Outside hotel, bustling and busy street, loads of buses, a laundry across road, did all the 6 days previous washing for a snip, much cheaper than Hotel. No negatives, apart from small rooms, no view, but hey we are in Hong Kong to explore, not sleep, and space is an issue there. Fine Fine fine.

Reviews.Title: “Average stay for a good price.”
Reviews.Author: crimbles
Reviews.Content: 4 night stay at the Charterhouse. Good location just off the main Johnston Road in Wan Chai with easy access to the MTR station. The hotel itself has dated decor and rooms unless you upgrade to the Signature floor. The standard rooms are basic and very small but fine for a base, with tea and coffee facilities. Full size bath with overhead shower. TV's in the room feature only foreign channels. Fantastically hilarious lighting console next to the bed, great entertainment. The concierge gave us plenty of information and the sports bar downstairs is ok for a few drinks before bed. Average hotel for those on a budget or not too fussy about having modern decor and a large room.

Reviews.Title: “This place looks alot better on the internet”
Reviews.Author: MsC1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Charterhouse for 4 nights during April, and our experience was not as pleasant as other recent reviews. Our room did not resemble those shown on the hotel website - the interiors are in need of a revamp, with old carpets and soft furnishings as well as marked walls. There was also a hole in our bathroom wall. The bathroom could also have been cleaner. However, the air conditioning was in working order. Due to the renovations taking place in the building, there was construction noise outside the stated hours (ie before 9am). There is also construction work taking place in the building next door to the hotel. Note that access to the gym needs to be made via the fire stairs, which was also being used by the construction workmen and there was a fair amount of dust/debris in this area. The gym equipment is fairly old, but still usable. Note that there are no gym attendants and the gym is in a rather secluded part of the building. Overall, there are better accommodation options in this area/price range.

Reviews.Title: “good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Jamsey
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 9 days in the Charterhouse and found it to be great value and handy for most places. Staff are very friendly and the restaurant buffet is fine but a little bit expensive. The room I had was a bit small but it had all I needed and everything was spotless. I'd certainly recommend it to anyone visiting Hong Kong

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: skulnes
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 7 wonderful days in Hong Kong. The excellent location of The Charterhouse was of great value for us. Only a couple of minutes from the MTR, a few blocks from the Star Ferry, close to several shopping malls, and a great variety of restaurants nearby. For us it is also important to live at a clean and friendly hotel. In spite of renovations taking place at the moment, it was a very peaceful hotel. The staff was also very friendly and helpful in answering our questions prior to our visit. All in all, great value and we highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, clean and cheap for hong kong”
Reviews.Author: kinka00
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed at the Charterhouse for 6 nights and we had a brilliant time. We contacted them via e-mail and they offered us a really cheap rate, cheaper than even 2 star hotels in the same area, they were completely adaptable as we changed our itinerary four times and they also organized bus transport from the airport straight to their hotel. The hotel itself is not the Ritz but the rooms are spacious with high ceilings, very clean, have aircon, tv and the funniest lighting system ever. Buttons everywherevery. The bathroom was clean, new and had a really good showerbath. We were on the eleventh floor with view of the racecourse and even with the window open could hardly hear any street noise. With the window closed it was heavenly quiet. Quieter than even the novotel which I stayed at shortly after The location is fantastic as it is two streets away from Times Square, a thirty second walk to Hennessy Road which has the tram line running 24/7. Also, it is only a five minute walk straight down to the harbour where you can catch the Star Ferry to Kowloon. The staff were friendly but not all of them spoke fluent english. Breakfast buffet was a bit on the expensive side for me as I don't really eat all that much in the morning. But it was an impressive buffet with full english breakfast, chinese style food, fruit, cereal etc. All in all we had a brilliant time exploring Hong Kong from this small but cosy hotel in the middle of this amazing city and can only recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Irritating credit card problems”
Reviews.Author: Junda2
Reviews.Content: This hotel has its good and bad sides. I stayed there for 7 nights with my 9 colleagues, so we all formed about the same opinions. Breakfasts were great. Room service was very good and very helpful and polite staff of room service. However, the rooms are very small and the beds are too short for non-Chinese people. There was no promised Internet access in the room. That is, there was a connection but it required different cables than we had and we were not allowed to use it (they offered us to use Business Room internet for HKD 100, which is quite unfair). Then, the biggest problem some of us had was their reservation of big sums from our debit and credit cards without any warning. When we arrived to the hotel, we were asked to provide our cards "just in case you use the minibar, etc.". By the way, all 5 minibars were empty. We discovered afterwards that they reserved ("authorised" in their terminology) HKD 1550 on the debit cards without even informing us. We had to ask a few times until the problem was solved and the withheld money returned to the cards. As a result we could not use these sums in HK. We thought it completely unfair. Then, when we booked a trip to Mainland China through the hotel, they took money (HKD 950) twice from my credit card. I still did not get it returned. So, enjoy your stay in the hotel but be careful when letting them use your credit cards.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but aging”
Reviews.Author: jcb3
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here on business three different times over the past year, for a total of about 10 days. First time I had a Superior room (one queen bed). The room was OK, tiny as most Asian rooms are, but the furnishings were pretty beat up. Clean bath, comfy bed, handy fridge. As with all of the rooms I've stayed in, the lighting control panel was an abomination - poorly designed initially, 30 years of service has only made it worse. Next trip I stayed in a single - a tiny, tiny room with a single (twin) bed, which I actually found to be quite charming. It was like being in a cozy ship's cabin, with everything within arm's reach. Once again, the room was clean and comfy. Located at the end of the hall, it was very quiet, too. Finally, I stayed on the business floor (23F? Not the new 2F Executive Floor). This was a joke. They cram a king bed in a regular room, and throw in extra stuff that is either superfluous or otherwise available at reasonable cost anyway (breakfast, Internet, etc). My "business" neighbors included screaming children. Definitely not worth the extra cost. The staff has been uniformly professional and helpful. Breakfast buffet is OK if it's included in the room, but overpriced otherwise. The basement restaurant is unpredictable - a "set" dinner was creative and well prepared (although marred by overcooked chicken), but fish and chips later that week was an inedible sodden greasy mass. The neighborhood has a wonderful mix of shops, restaurants, and markets (and a cheap and handy laundry directly across from the hotel). There are tourists, but it's mainly a locals area. Times Square is a 5 minute stroll. Many city buses stop at the front door, although figuring out the routes is a challenge. Despite some warts, and aged furnishings, this is a decent hotel for the price, plus they often have rooms available even during peak convention times.

Reviews.Title: “Central Heaven”
Reviews.Author: taurus1960
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with my wife for three nights during mid-October 2006. The location is superb with all the usual tourist attractions within easy walking distance. Do not expect luxury at this hotel but it provides clean, honest value for money accomodation. The staff are very helpful and on hand at all times of the day. Use the concierges knowledge and experience to get you out and about. We booked room and breakfast, which was first class. The food selection was above average and catered for all tastes. Im not going to go and on about where you should go, etc but suffice to say the HOTEL LOCATION IS SECOND TO NONE and we would definitely return to this hotel to use as a base for our future trips. PS: - Happy Valley Racecourse (use the tram HK£2) is just 5 minutes away and is a must on a Wednesday night - great atmosphere - the food and drink is superb AND its costs as little as 60 pence to get in - great nights entertainment - we won £120! GO ON STAY HERE AT THE CHARTERHOUSE YOU KNOW IT MAKES SENSE - YOU WONT REGRET IT!
